info.title: Dédalo Publication Server REST API 1.0.25
info.description:
Builds Public Dédalo data for publication. Use this online tool to test your data, and remember to always enter your authentication code when running a test call.
This API is focused on Oral History files and is for general purpose. If you need special functions or custom results, you can join the API development team by contacting the source developers (also known as Alex & Paco) at webmaster@render.es

tags.name: Video view
tags.description: Utils for get video player general data

db_name.name: db_name
db_name.description: Database name. If not defined, the default database will be used

lang.name: lang
lang.description: Query lang filter. Use Dédalo lang format like lg-eng for english. If undefined, API server settings default lang is used

ar_fields.name: ar_fields
ar_fields.description:
Comma separated list of required columns in table. Stringified array is also allowed
Sample:
["name","surname"]

rows_per_page.name: rows_per_page
rows_per_page.description: Number of records in each page

post.description: Search records with current params in requested table. This is similar to a basic sql query but note that not all commands are supported or allowed for security reasons.

parameters.name: section_id
parameters.description: Filter by specific section_id. Like 1. Also, it is valid a sequence separated by comma, like 1,4,5

parameters.name: sql_fullselect
parameters.description: Custom sql select for builds query. Replaces any other columns or table selection option. i.e. 'SELECT mycolumn FROM mytable'

parameters.name: sql_filter
parameters.description: Custom query added to standard filter

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Custom order for result. Set null for no sort. Sample: 'name ASC, surname ASC'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum records returned in query. 0 for no limit

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: Custom group query for sql like 'lang'

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Custom records offset for query

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Activates total records counter for pagination

parameters.name: resolve_portal
parameters.description: Activates automatic resolution of portals option. Default is false

parameters.name: resolve_portals_custom
parameters.description:
Resolve requested portals only. Use a json map object like
{"audiovisual":"audiovisual","informant":"informant"}
where key is column name and value is target table. To resolve deeper, use format '{"table.column":"table"}'

parameters.name: resolve_dd_relations
parameters.description:
Activates automatic resolution of column "dd_relations". This column stores all calls to current record formatted as locators array. Note that resolution map is stored in "publication_schema" (from Ontology definition).
Sample:
{ "diffusion": { "class_name": "diffusion_mysql" }, "publication_schema": { "dd_relations": { "rsc170": "images", "oh1": "interview" } }, "publication_schema_info": "Use format {table_name.field_name:target_table} or {field_name:target_table} for multiple map" }

parameters.name: map
parameters.description:
Deprecated.
Use "process_result" instead
Call using json representation of array of objects like
[{ "table": "informant", "field":birthplace_id", "function":"resolve_geolocation", "output_field":"birthplace_obj" }]
Already defined functions:
resolve_geolocation

parameters.name: process_result
parameters.description:
Used to manage very specific scenarios where get_records call its not enough
Call using a json object like
{"fn":"process_result::add_parents_and_children_recursive","columns": [{"name":"parents"}]}
Used in numisdata catalog tree to create the records hierarchy in server side
{"fn":"process_result::break_down_totals","base_column":"term_id","total_column":"total"}
Used for example to split interview informants place of birth when more than one informant or place exists
{"fn":"process_result::resolve_indexation_fragments","column":"indexation","fragment_terms":false}
Used to autoresolve indexation column values of "exhibitions" table in qdp
Already defined functions
(@see ../dedalo/lib/dedalo/publication/server_api/v1/common/class.process_result.php):
add_parents_and_children_recursive
add_parents_or_children
break_down_totals
sum_totals
resolve_indexation_fragments

post.summary: Get first level of terms from thesaurus
post.description:
Return an array of 'ts_term' objects with resolved data. You can use only the data or (in PHP) manage 'ts_term' objects to build custom html.
 This functionality requires that all thesaurus tables follow the same schema. Besides, the root terms will be considered the xx1_1 terms. To able work you must configure your Dédalo thesaurus data in this way.
 For example, for thesaurus 'Themes' with tld 'ts' must be exists a root term 'Themes' with section_id 1. This will be publish as term_id 'ts1_1' to be discoberable by the API.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Optional comma separated names of thesaurus tables. If undefined, server config thesaurus tables are used

parameters.name: parents
parameters.description: Optional comma separated parents used as roots like 'hierarchy1_245,hierarchy1_253'. If defined, override default behaviour (from first elements of table like 'ts1_1)

parameters.name: exclude_tld
parameters.description: Optional comma separated list of tld to exclude like 'xx,rt'

parameters.name: exclude_tld

post.description: Execute a search against thesaurus tables

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Optional comma separated names of thesaurus tables. If undefined, server config thesaurus tables are used

parameters.name: exclude_tld

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: string to search in database. Minimum 3 chars for full text search

parameters.name: tree_root
parameters.description: Defines first element from build the hierarchy tree when showing the results. Accepted values first_parent | last_parent . Default is last_parent

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Optional comma separated names of thesaurus tables. If undefined, server config thesaurus tables are used

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: string to search in database. Minimum 3 chars for full text search

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Result format ('full' for object including term_id and 'simple' for term plain text). Default is 'simple'

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of records returned. Undefined uses default of 25

post.summary: Get thesaurus term objects (one or various)

parameters.name: ar_term_id
parameters.description: Comma separated list of one or various term_id like 'ts1_1,ts1_2'

parameters.name: combine
parameters.description: Experimental (!). Optional combined result mode. Options: false | combined. Default is false. When is set to combine, only indexations with intersections are returned

post.summary: Indexation object with all required info

parameters.name: ar_locators

parameters.name: image_type
parameters.description: Selects type of image to use. Values are 'identify_image', 'posterframe'. Default is posterframe

post.description: Exec a search against transcription column in audiovisual table

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: String to search. This field is Full-text search (normally transcription column 'rsc36')

parameters.name: is_literal
parameters.description: Allow search literals like "my house"

parameters.name: rows_per_page
parameters.description: Number of records returned by page. Default is 10

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Current page number (pagination params)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset used to paginate results. Default is 0

parameters.name: appearances_limit
parameters.description: Max number of appearances (matches) calculated. Default is 1

parameters.name: match_select
parameters.description: Selects a specific match inside results. For example, to get only the first appearance of a word. Optional

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Exec total records count. Default is true

parameters.name: image_type
parameters.description: Type of image returned. Options are posterframe | identify_image.  Default is posterframe

parameters.name: list_fragment
parameters.description: Resolve text fragment to show in list mode (small text, without video cut). Default is true

parameters.name: video_fragment
parameters.description: Activates video fragment resolution (with extended transcription fragment and video cut). Default is false

parameters.name: fragment_terms
parameters.description: Calculates terms (indexations) for current fragment of transcription.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Apply a filter to result like 'section_tipo = 1'

post.description: Get full reel data. Complete transcription without tc cut. Used when you need show full interview (mode full)

parameters.name: av_section_id
parameters.description: Section id number to filter records

parameters.name: image_type
parameters.description: Type of image returned. Options are posterframe | identify_image.  Default is posterframe

parameters.name: terms
parameters.description: Resolves current transcription indexed terms. Default is false

post.summary: Find word/s in table global_search. Require a special server config!
post.description: Exec a search against full_data column in global_search table

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: String to search (performs a full text search in column full_data)

parameters.name: search_modifier
parameters.description:
MySQL search_modifier 
(IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE | IN NATURAL LANGUAGE MODE WITH QUERY EXPANSION | IN BOOLEAN MODE | WITH QUERY EXPANSION)

parameters.name: sql_filter
parameters.description: Custom additional filter query (normally is added to standard filter 'q'). Example: filter_date >= 1936

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Exec total records count. Default is true

parameters.name: rows_per_page
parameters.description: Number of records returned by page. Default is 10

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Current page number (pagination params)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset used to paginate results. Default is 0

post.summary: Combined calls to api in one request
post.description: Exec an array of api requests in only one call to the server.

parameters.name: ar_calls
parameters.description:
JSON array of calls to api (stringified or not). Will be iterated and resolved in the server side.
Sample:
[ { "id":"templates_all", "options":{ "dedalo_get":"records", "table":"template_map", "ar_fields":["data","name"], "lang":"lg-spa" } }, { "id":"menu_all", "options":{ "dedalo_get":"records", "table":"ts_web", "ar_fields":["section_id","term_id","term","web_path","parent","children","template_name","title","abstract","body","norder","image"], "lang":"lg-spa" } } ]
